data.title: ‘Classified’ data suggest huge Russian losses in Ukraine
data.description: LONDON - Forty-eight thousand relatives of Russian troops have submitted DNA samples, a government minister has been recorded as saying, in a sensitive discussion apparently referring to attempts to identify dead soldiers by their remains.

data.title: Russian actress's family bids farewell after she drowns in Samui waves
data.description: The father and boyfriend of a Russian actress who tragically drowned after being swept off a cliff by waves while practicing yoga in Ko Samui have arrived to claim her body and perform a Buddhist funeral ceremony.

data.title: Ex-minister seen in Chiang Mai after release from prison
data.description: CHIANG MAI - Former commerce minister  Boonsong Teriyapirom  has been seen in public for the first time since his release on  parole  on Monday, after serving more than seven years in prison for corruption linked to the Yingluck Shinawatra government’s  rice pledging  scheme.

data.title: Minister denies detention rule could favour Yingluck
data.description: Justice Minister Tawee Sodsong on Wednesday dismissed claims that a new regulation allowing for the  detention  of inmates outside prison would benefit fugitive former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra .

data.title: Siam Paragon’s 19th Anniversary: A Magical Milestone
data.description: Siam Paragon, a name synonymous with luxury and global prestige, marks its 19th anniversary with a dazzling celebration aptly titled “Siam Paragon 19th Anniversary: The Magical Celebration.” Running from December 2 to 10, 2024, the festivities showcase why this iconic destination remains a favourite among Thais and international visitors alike.

data.title: PalFish Opens Second English Learning Centre in Thailand
data.description: PalFish Thailand proudly celebrated the grand opening of its second  PalFish Experience Center  at  Future Park Rangsit  (Campus Park, 3rd Floor, Central Zone) on  3 December 2024.  Designed for children aged 3–15, this state-of-the-art centre offers one-on-one English lessons with native-speaking teachers, supported by cutting-edge technology and interactive applications for a modern, effective learning experience.

data.title: House panel raises border concerns
data.description: The House committee on  national security , border affairs, national strategy and national reform is planning to address border tension involving the  United Wa State Army  (UWSA) on Dec 13.

data.title: Minister to address dugong, seagrass crisis
data.description: Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Chalermchai Sri-on is scheduled to visit Trang on Saturday to assess the dugong population and the crisis of seagrass ecosystem degradation.

data.title: Barge collides with 5 dining boats, speedboat on Chao Phraya in Bangkok
data.description: Strong tides led to a cable snapping, leading to accident

data.title: Laurent Perves Appointed CEO of Vacheron Constantin
data.description: Vacheron Constantin is pleased to announce the appointment of Laurent Perves as the Maison’s CEO, effective 1st January 2025. He succeeds Louis Ferla, with whom he has worked closely over the past eight years.

data.title: Thais elated over international recognition for ‘Tom Yum Kung’
data.description: But see no big impact on their businesses or food choices

data.title: African sex traffickers arrested
data.description: Three Africans have been arrested on suspicion of being part of a gang known as "madam" that trafficks women from Africa into prostitution in Bangkok.

data.title: 1,000 arrests made in crackdown on proxies
data.description: More than 1,000 Thai and foreign nationals have been rounded up in a joint operation by police and commerce ministry authorities for the use of Thai  nominees  by foreign businesses over the past few weeks, authorities said on Wednesday.

data.title: Thai business sector protests against 400-baht minimum wage plan
data.description: Three key business agencies will file a formal protest against the nationwide wage plan, saying it could hinder economic recovery

data.title: Suvarnabhumi celebrates Unesco award for new terminal
data.description: Suvarnabhumi Airport  is celebrating its Prix Versailles award from  Unesco  for exceptional exterior design of its Midfield Satellite 1 ( SAT-1 ) terminal.

data.title: Thailand to host Women’s Volleyball World Championship next year
data.description: Thailand’s Cabinet on Tuesday approved a proposal to host the 2025 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship in a bid to stimulate tourism and the economy.

data.title: TCMA Showcases Saraburi Sandbox Progress at COP29
data.description: TCMA showcased the one-year progress of the ‘Saraburi Sandbox’ at COP29, uniting local and global stakeholders to accelerate joint actions by combining policy, technology, funding, and governance to enhance Thailand’s access to green funding towards achieving Net Zero 2050.

data.title: Thailand at risk due to govt’s financial mismanagement: TDRI chief
data.description: Somkiat said that the country’s credit rating could be downgraded if the government does not improve its macroeconomic management

data.title: Thai healthcare and wellness industry expected to grow by 9% annually
data.description: The healthcare industry is expected to grow by close to 9 per cent annually amid beauty trends and the transition towards an ageing society, several experts said on Wednesday.

data.title: SolarEdge Introduces Three-Phase Solar Solution for Thailand
data.description: SolarEdge Technologies, a global leader in smart energy technology, has announced the availability of its Three-phase SolarEdge Home ecosystem in Thailand. This comprehensive solution is designed to optimise energy savings, storage, and backup capabilities for homeowners, featuring the SolarEdge Home Hub Inverter, SolarEdge Power Optimisers, SolarEdge Home Battery, and SolarEdge Home Backup Interface. The system is managed via the mySolarEdge app, enabling homeowners to monitor, control, and optimise solar production, energy use, and carbon reduction seamlessly.

data.title: CHANINTR Unveils Minotti’s  2024 Collection
data.description: Blending Cultures and Styles into Timeless Contemporary Designs

data.title: Universo Ferrari Debuts in Southeast Asia's Thailand
data.description: Universo Ferrari, an immersive exhibition celebrating the world of Ferrari, has opened its doors in Thailand. This landmark event marks the fourth such exhibition globally, following Italy, Australia, and Korea, and is the first in Southeast Asia.

data.title: Thonburi and Geely Launch First Right-Hand Drive EX5
data.description: Thonburi Group, a leading Thai automotive company, and Geely, a globally recognised innovator in the automotive industry, have announced a strategic partnership to distribute Geely vehicles in Thailand. This collaboration, managed by Thonburi Neustern Co., Ltd., encompasses sales, marketing, and after-sales services, marking a significant milestone in Thailand

data.title: Port Authority working towards green and smart future logistics hubs
data.description: Chief outlines plan to tap technology and implement innovative solutions

data.title: River tug towing barges crashes into moored boats
data.description: A  tugboat  pulling heavily  loaded barges  hit six moored  tour boats ,  sinking one  and injuring a woman, on the Chao Phraya River in Bangkok on Wednesday.

data.title: Paetongtarn eyes tie-up with Nvidia to turn Thailand into AI hub
data.description: The PM meets Nvidia CEO to discuss collaboration in developing Thai AI industry, building world-class infrastructure, sharing expertise and fostering talent
